pageContext.claim: “But the [trade] deficit [with Japan] is massive, which — changing rapidly.”
pageContext.analysis: This is wrong. The deficit in goods and services with Japan is up slightly under Trump. It was $57 billion in 2016, before he took office, and it was $58 billion in 2018, according to the Bureau of Economic Analysis. So it's slightly higher. The trade deficit also is not especially "massive," compared to  China ($381 billion), Mexico ($79 billion) and Germany ($67 billion).
